{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Westell |model=VersaLink 7501 |revision=(A90-750115-07) |asin=B0039WFVLY |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/21/2007 |fcc_id=CH87500XX-07 |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6359S;BCM6359SKFBG, UG0821 P11, 873260 01; |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K8P3215UQB |fla1_num=2 |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM6AA160TS-5G |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4318E;BCM4318EKFBG, HD0821 P20, 872684 B4; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM5325E;BCM5325EKQMG, RG0825 P11, 878197 1A; |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=08FXxxxxxxxx,VZHRXXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^08FX[0-9]{8}$,,,^VZHR[0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=192.168.200.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=00:18:3A |oui_eth=00:18:3A }} {{TagLine|Verizon Westell VersaLink 7501}}
AKA the router that Verizon sold for like ten bucks shipped next-day free. :See [https://sites.google.com/a/tds.net/unlock-your-verizon-westell-7501-wireless-g-router/ Lemonade] <small> *The default SSID is the serial number. A sample serial number is ''08FX08012314'' :(''08FXxxxxxx'' is one likely pattern, some devices may use other variants).
*The devices also broadcast a hidden SSID by default. Sample SSID is ''VZHR012314'' :(it simply appears to be ''VZHR'' followed by the last 6 digits of the serial number). :Pressing the WPS button on the top of the unit will unmask the SSID temporarily. </small>
The power adapter included with the device is a :''Westell'' MT12-4120100-A1 (12V/1A).
===Links=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=65443 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://archive.slickdeals.net/f/1874458-Verizon-Wireless-802-11b-g-Wireless-Router-w-4-Switch-Ports-6-50? On '''SlickDeals''']
